Topic.Title: How to hook up your Windows Phone Or Windows 8 PC to Speakers and play some of that great free music on XBOX Music.

Message.Msg: You can also use your existing tv soundbar if it is blu tooth or you can add the blu tooth audio receiver if it has a 3.5 mm input or USB accessories input for sending Windows Phone music to.

Topic.Title: How to hook up your Windows Phone Or Windows 8 PC to Speakers and play some of that great free music on XBOX Music.

Message.Msg: Soundbars are the long separate sets os speakers that are now popular for tv sets. It is possible to hook a blu tooth receiver directly to tv USB if it has a USB input.

Topic.Title: WHO Is Responsible For Android's Security Fiascos?

Message.Msg: "...protect the user..." LOL like Microsoft has been protecting the Windows user all these years? The problem with an endless stream of security patches is that it's endless, immediately implying that there are a boundless set of flaws yet to be fixed, requiring boundless time to get around to them, even once discovered and reported. As a Windows user you are guaranteed that after every Patch Tuesday you have a full month of vulnerabiliy to suffer and chew your nails through until the next Patch Tuesday.

Message.Title: Next Generation Windows 8 Tablets....
Message.Msg: Intel will launch its new “Bay Trail” update to the Atom lineup in Q3/2013, and it’s expected to be far more powerful than any earlier Atom chip… while still allowing PC/Tablet makers to build thin and light devices that "get all day battery life and last in standby mode for weeks at a time". Bay Trail is expected to offer twice the performance of today’s Clover Trail chips, while allowing for Tablets as thin as 0.3 inches and will be capable of running full Windows 8, Office, Skype and Xbox videos and gaming. They’ll also be the first Atom processors to feature Intel HD 4000 and higher graphics. That means that not only will you be able to watch HD video, but you should be able to do some 3D PC gaming and other tasks that use hardware acceleration.

Message.Title: Nokia Lumia 521 With Wi-Fi Calling Arrives At T-Mobile Stores On 22nd May....
Message.Msg: The Nokia Lumia 521 smartphone, which is exclusive to T-Mobile in the U.S., is going to be available at T-Mobile retail stores, T-Mobile’s website and various select dealers and national retailers from 22nd May for an upfront payment of $29.99 with equal monthly payments to be made over the next 24 months. The Lumia 521 is available on T-Mobile’s Simple Choice Plans, the monthly payment will come down to $5, payable over two years. This Windows Phone 8 powered smartphone is a good entry level addition to the carrier’s line up. Nokia Lumia 521 has a 4 inch touchscreen, a 5 megapixel camera on the back, exclusive Nokia apps such as Cinemagraph and Creative. It is also compatible with T-Mobile’s 4G network, making it quite the impressive package. Lumia 521 sold directly through T-Mobile will also feature Wi-Fi calling, which will be of essential use to travelers, as it allows them to make or receive phone calls from their U.S. number while being connected to Wi-Fi, anywhere in the world. Those who have already purchased one through either HSN, Walmart or Microsoft retail stores will receive an OTA update on 20th May to enable the Wi-Fi calling feature.

"At AllThingsD's Dive Into Mobile conference earlier this week, Windows Phone exec Terry Myerson downplayed the idea of the software giant jumping directly into the smartphone hardware ring. The post are to illustrate that a City is always going to go for a switch and bait ploy to save several hundred thousand they can spend on expensive dinners and trips. The point is Google low balls Microsoft bids and then pulls a switch and bait. When they want to do something they used to do for no extra cost from Microsoft, Google says there will be an extra charge for that. So it is a switch and bait low ball predator tactic and by a company that is putting the entire USA security at jeopardy. Not maybe putting the Countries security in jeopardy, 100% definitely absolutely positively they are. When the FBI says it, you may want to make some changes regarding that Linux hippie shet. I was just with someone in Washington, DC that has high security clearance and is a IT contractor for an agency I cannot mention. He wiped out an Andriod when I asked him to check on a medicine my Mother was taking. My phone was out in my car because I was cutting the grass. He pulls out an Andriod. I said don't you have high level security clearance and you know about the Android and all the problems with Malware, spying etc. He said yea I guess. No other comment and could not care less. Message.Title: Android Malware On Google Play Downloads Spyware To Monitor Texts, Call Logs, Location (Source Mobile &Apps)....
Message.Msg: Security researchers found a new piece of Android malware on Google Play: a downloader that downloads a spyware app to monitor texts, call logs and location. The authors behind the malicious code apparently disguised their hoax under the guise of font-installing apps. Offering an application that claims to legitimately download more content can bypass Google Play's security systems and spread malicious code. Security firm Webroot identified the threat as "Android.TechnoReaper" and points out that it's quite cleverly disguised. The app doesn't seem too popular, but the risk exists. "Once you install the app, it looks like a nice app used to install new fonts on your phone," notes the security firm. "Everything looks legitimate, but if you look in the code you'll see you could get more than you bargained for." The malicious apps found on Google Play download spyware called iKno Android Spy. It remains unclear whether iKno Android Spy actually does everything it claims to do or whether it also sends the data to a third party as well. If another app is downloading it, for instance, uses no longer have control over what iKno is doing.

Topic.Title: Android Malware On Google Play Downloads Spyware To Monitor Texts, Call Logs, Location (Source Mobile &Apps)....

Message.Msg: Here’s what the iKno spyware is capable of pulling: •Write and send SMS texts, as well as monitor or modify incoming messages. The same applies for inbound messages or MMS. •Write data on the external storage card •Monitor and modify in any way outgoing calls or even initiate a call without actually going through the UI •Track location using the cellular network / Wi-Fi / GPS or initiate network activity •Access and modify contact data, audio settings and even record audio events Now imagine all of this happening without your knowledge. Once the spyware is installed, administrator access is granted to another supervisor and sensitive data of any nature is re-directed to an online server. As bad as it sounds, this kind of application can squeeze almost any password or private information users wish to keep secret.
